title: Ticket #4579: isQueueSuperUser should use case-insensitive usernames on Windows
description:
On windows, usernames are case-insensitive. but when the SCHEDD checks to see if a username is a member of the queue super users group, it uses a case-sensitive comparison. This problem is exacerbated by the fact that case is preserved in some parts of HTCondor but not in others, so that if a username is not defined to be all lowercase, in some places it will forced to all lowercase before comparing it to the superusers list.

View the admin rust queue a user comments: At (roughly) line 1483 in the \condor-8.2.1\src\condor_schedd.V6\qmgmt.cpp file, there is a block of code (in OwnerCheck2) that compares the usernames of the job owner and the entity trying to connect to the queue. Here is the relevant code ... 

   // Finally, compare the owner of the ad with the entity trying
   // to connect to the queue.
#if defined(WIN32)
   // WIN32: user names are case-insensitive
   if (strcasecmp(job_owner, test_owner) =3D=3D 0) {
#else
   if (strcmp(job_owner, test_owner) =3D=3D 0) {
#endif
   return true;
   }

   if (isQueueSuperUser(test_owner)) {
      dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "OwnerCheck retval 1 (success), super_user\n");
      return true;
   }

Note that the first part of this block of code in OwnerCheck2 correctly compares the two usernames on Windows platforms using a case insensitive function (strcasecmp). However, the second part of this block of code invokes isQueueSuperUser() to test if test_owner is one of the users named in the QUEUE_SUPER_USERS macro - and, the corresponding comparison in isQueueSuperUser() is still using a case sensitive function - here is the code (in isQueueSuperUser) from (roughly) line 1306 of the same file. 

   if( strcmp( user, super_users[i] ) =3D=3D 0 ) {
      return true;
   }

This code should be changed so that it uses case-insensitive comparison logic also.
